Shift:- 9 AM to 6 PM

*Job Summary:*

We are seeking two experienced and self-driven Full Stack Developers with a strong background in AI technologies and Microsoft tech stack to support the development of a bespoke AI platform. This is an exciting opportunity to work on a cutting-edge initiative in a fast-paced environment.

 


Key Requirements:
 •     Strong proficiency in TypeScript and Python

 •     Experience deploying and managing applications on Microsoft Azure
 •     Awareness of Azure Databricks and Azure Data Factory is a plus (not required)
 •     Experience with Microsoft Office add-in development is a bonus

*Key Responsibilities:*

Design, develop, and implement scalable full-stack solutions for an AI-driven platform.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including product owners, architects, and QA to deliver robust features.
Integrate APIs and ensure secure, performant data exchange across systems.
Leverage Azure cloud services for application hosting, data processing, and AI integrations.
Write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code using modern development practices.
Contribute to architectural decisions and technology roadmap related to AI and full-stack applications.
 

*Required Skills & Experience:*


8–10 years of hands-on experience in full stack development.
Strong proficiency in front-end and back-end technologies (e.g., React, Angular, .NET Core, Node.js).
Proven experience with Azure Cloud services (App Services, Azure Functions, Azure DevOps, etc.).
Demonstrated experience in AI/ML integration within applications.
Strong understanding and experience in API integration and microservices architecture.
Excellent debugging, problem-solving, and communication skills.
 

*Nice to Have:*

Experience working on bespoke AI platforms or enterprise-level AI applications.
Familiarity with containerization tools like Docker and orchestration with Kubernetes.
Exposure to Agile delivery models and CI/CD pipelines.

Location: Pune

·  Supporting data migration initiatives from legacy infrastructure to modern platforms like Mesh and
·  Refactoring legacy pipelines with code reuse, version control, and infrastructure-as- code best practices.

 systems.

Technical Expertise
·        Azure

Not every Wednesday feels productive.

But today, showing up at the office reminded me why WFO still matters.

Yes, WFH is comfortable, flexible, and has its charm. But WFO brings something else— momentum.

The energy when you walk in. The shift in mindset. The small greetings. The unplanned catch-ups. Even the background buzz has a rhythm to it.

You start your day dressed, focused, and surrounded by people chasing their own goals— and that quietly pushes you to move forward too.

You brainstorm better. You collaborate faster. You get those mini breaks where you laugh, stretch, and share ideas without a screen freeze.

It’s not about picking a side— it’s about knowing what works for you that day.

And today, WFO won.
